subject: Supply service & busconfig ACLs from the repo.
commitMessage:
Supply service & busconfig ACLs from the repo.

This change required as a part of privilege separation work:
  https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/issues/3383

Dependant meta-phosphor change:
  https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/41430

Signed-off-by: Anton D. Kachalov <gmouse@google.com>
Change-Id: Ic0b1b57f8a088defe096f1ab793efa1f015ca5be

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/41430

Not sure if bumping src rev without c/41430 will work. It's tested within several month already. Did check with Redfish API.
Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged by Jayanth Othayoth
@raviteja is this change ok, not sure why you added
The file has been moved under dist directory.
I feel we should have this check for including bmc-vmi-ca-manager service file

Service file has been covered by a specific flag that is set in openbmc recipe:

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/41430/21/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/certificate/phosphor-certificate-manager_git.bb
is this still required as we had removed it in makefile.am
I can drop it here. The specific service unit files are covered by their own conditional flags.
this is dead ink?

Yeah, it's dead in every single modern distro:
https://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-daemon.1.html#configuration_file

Seems to be dead for a year+:
https://web.archive.org/web/20190815000000*/https://specifications.freedesktop.org/dbus/1.0/busconfig.dtd

https://specifications.freedesktop.org/

We can not do anything about that.
Question: Where is this used?
All those vars should be used in dist/Makefile.am
If we make these conditional (vs. it wasn't before), would we have to change users of this repo to add the flags in their bbappend to enable this feature in order not to regress?

This is done in dependant change:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/41430

This is generally followed for having local service files
for this bcc-vmi-ca we have ibm specific service file
The file has been moved to the dist/ directory and being conditionally enabled by the flag.

what is the problem in having this check
it has been followed

I drop it from another Makefile.am and cover the bmc-vmi-ca service installation by other flag. Is there a use case when we build this service without systemd (is there an openbmc-based distro without systemd)?
Generally speaking, certificate-manager requires sdbusplus library that implies dependency to libsystemd. Therefore, this package can not be built without systemd.
can you please explain why is this UMask need?
This drops world flags from any created files. The certificate manager creates private keys that is world accessible.

this bmc-vmi-ca service does not create any files.
this service is for host certificate management, which hosts objects to share CSR with host interface and get client certificate from host interface.
In this particular case without any filesystem access UMask has no-op. We can either drop it or keep.
